isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - OUTPUT SHAFT AND REAR BEARING ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: OUTPUT SHAFT AND REAR BEARING ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the low speed gear ( Figure 163).

figure.caption: Figure 163. Install Snap Ring in Low Speed Gear

important.para: For timing purposes, mark two adjacent teeth on the low speed gear and mark the two teeth directly opposite.

step1.para: Place the output shaft on a bench with the threaded end up and install the low speed gear stepped washer, large diameter down ( Figure 164).

figure.caption: Figure 164. Install Low Speed Gear Stepped Washer

step1.para: Install the splined spacer on the shaft and washer ( Figure 165).

figure.caption: Figure 165. Install Splined Spacer on Shaft and Washer

step1.para: Install the low speed gear on the splined spacer, clutching teeth down ( Figure 166).

figure.caption: Figure 166. Install Low Speed Gear on Splined Spacer

step1.para: Install the low speed gear rear washer on the shaft, stepped side of the washer up ( Figure 167).

figure.caption: Figure 167. Install Low Speed Gear Rear Washer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the front cone of the rear bearing on the shaft and against the washer ( Figure 168). (Heating of the bearing will facilitate installation).

figure.caption: Figure 168. Install Front Cone of Rear Bearing on Shaft

note.para: Use heat lamps, but do not heat over 275°F (136°C).

step1.para: Install the bearing inner spacer on the shaft ( Figure 169).
Place the front bearing cup partially into the bore of the housing, taper to the inside ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Place Front Bearing Cup Partially into Bore of Housing

step1.para: Place the bearing outer spacer on the front cup and place the rear bearing cup on the spacer ( Figure 171).

figure.caption: Figure 171. Place Bearing Outer Spacer on Front Cup and Rear Bearing Cup on Spacer

step1.para: Tap all three units evenly into the rear bore until the lip of the rear cup seats against the housing ( Figure 172).

figure.caption: Figure 172. Tap Units Evenly into Rear Bore

step1.para: Place the auxiliary rear housing over the end of the shaft and seat the front bearing cone in the front cup ( Figure 173).

figure.caption: Figure 173. Place Auxiliary Rear Housing Over End of Shaft

step1.para: Install the bearing rear cone on the shaft and into the rear cup ( Figure 174). (Heating of the bearing cone will facilitate installation, but do not heat over 275°F.)

figure.caption: Figure 174. Install Bearing Rear Cone on Shaft

step1.para: Install the oil seal in the rear bearing cover (inset, Figure 175). Seal should be installed so the spring is toward the front of the transmission.

figure.caption: Figure 175. Install Oil Seal in Rear Bearing Cover

step1.para: Install the rear bearing cover ( Figure 176). Tighten bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m). Install the brass washer and nylon sealing collar at the speedometer location ( inset).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Install Rear Bearing Cover, Brass Washer and Nylon Sealing Collar

step1.para: Place the direct-low shift fork into the yoke slot of the sliding clutch, short hub to the rear, and install the synchronizer assembly on the splines of the output shaft ( Figure 177).

figure.caption: Figure 177. Install Synchronizer Assembly on Splines of Output Shaft
